invariant_sets package

Submodules

invariant_sets.invariant_sets module

control_invariant_set(A, B, Cx, Cu)[source]

Computes the control-invariant set under dynamics A, B with state constraints Cx and control constraints Cu.

get_n_step_controllable_set(A, B, Cx, Cu, N, XT)[source]

Computes the N-step controllable set for system matrices A, B, state constraints Cx, control constraints Cu, and terminal set XT.

invariant_set(A, Cx)[source]

Computes the invariant set under transformation A with constraints Cx.

is_invariant(C, A)[source]

Checks if polytope C is invariant under the dynamics x_{t+1}=Ax_t

lqr_set(A, B, Q, R, Cx, Cu)[source]

Computes the LQR-invariant set for system matrices A, B, and weights Q, R.

one_step_controllable_set(A, B, Cx, Cu)[source]

Computes the one-step controllable set given system matrices A, B, state constraints Cx, and control constraints Cu.

pre_set(A, Cx)[source]

Computes the pre-set of polytope Cx under transformation A.

zero_set(n)[source]

Creates a zero set of dimension n (near origin).

invariant_sets.polytope module

class Polytope(A, b)[source]

Bases: object

contains(x, tol=1e-08)[source]

Check if a point x is inside the polytope. :param x: A point as a numpy array.

Returns:

True if the point is inside the polytope, False otherwise.

get_V_representation()[source]

Get the vertices (V-representation) of the polytope.

intersect(other)[source]

Compute the intersection of two polytopes (self and other). :returns: A new Polytope representing the intersection.

normalize(A, b)[source]

Normalize the inequalities to the form a^T x <= 1.

Parameters:

  • A (numpy.ndarray) – Inequality matrix of shape (m, n).

  • b (numpy.ndarray) – Right-hand side vector of shape (m,) or (m, 1).

Returns:

Normalized A and b.

Return type:

(numpy.ndarray, numpy.ndarray)

plot(ax=None, color='b', edgecolor='k', alpha=1.0, linestyle='-', showVertices=False)[source]

Plot the polytope using Matplotlib.

Parameters:

  • ax – Matplotlib axis object.

  • color – Fill color of the polytope.

  • edgecolor – Color of the polytope edges (if different from color).

  • alpha – Transparency of the fill.

  • linestyle – Line style for the edges.

  • showVertices – Boolean, whether to show the vertices as points.

projection(dims)[source]

Project the polytope onto the subspace of ‘dims’ using cddlib block_elimination. :param dims: Indices of the dimensions to keep. :type dims: list

remove_redundancies()[source]

Simplify the polytope by removing redundant constraints using matrix_canonicalize.

volume()[source]

Compute the volume of the polytope. Handles 1D intervals separately.

Module contents

class Polytope(A, b)[source]

Bases: object

Compute the intersection of two polytopes (self and other). :returns: A new Polytope representing the intersection.

normalize(A, b)[source]

Normalize the inequalities to the form a^T x <= 1.

Parameters:

  • A (numpy.ndarray) – Inequality matrix of shape (m, n).

  • b (numpy.ndarray) – Right-hand side vector of shape (m,) or (m, 1).

Returns:

Normalized A and b.

Return type:

(numpy.ndarray, numpy.ndarray)

Plot the polytope using Matplotlib.

  • color – Fill color of the polytope.

  • edgecolor – Color of the polytope edges (if different from color).

  • alpha – Transparency of the fill.

  • linestyle – Line style for the edges.

  • showVertices – Boolean, whether to show the vertices as points.

Project the polytope onto the subspace of ‘dims’ using cddlib block_elimination. :param dims: Indices of the dimensions to keep. :type dims: list

Simplify the polytope by removing redundant constraints using matrix_canonicalize.

Compute the volume of the polytope. Handles 1D intervals separately.
